intro: Adenochlaena leucocephala, commonly known as the white-headed adenochlaena, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy appearance. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
